snippet: An aide confirmed that Speaker Sheldon Silver earns money from legal fees in addition to the pay he has long acknowledged receiving from a personal-injury law firm, but did not offer more details.
abstract: New York State Assembly Speaker Sheldon Silver's spokesman confirms that Silver is earning money from legal fees as well as wages from personal-injury law firm Weitz & Luxenberg; attention to Silver’s outside income comes as Gov Andrew M Cuomo looks to enact far more stringent requirements on extralegislative sources of income, due to potential conflicts of interest.

byline.original: By SUSANNE CRAIG and WILLIAM K. RASHBAUM
byline.contributor: Susanne Craig reported from Albany, and William K. Rashbaum from New York.

lead_paragraph: An aide confirmed that Speaker Sheldon Silver earns money from legal fees in addition to the pay he has long acknowledged receiving from a personal-injury law firm, but did not offer more details.

headline.main: Silver, New York Assembly Speaker, Declines to Reveal Source of Some Outside Income
headline.print_headline: Money Source to Speaker of Assembly Is a Mystery

keywords.value: Moreland Commission to Investigate Public Corruption (NYS)
keywords.name: organizations
